summary: The bill, known as the TRACKS Act, mandates the tracking of taxpayer dollars sent to adversarial countries and foreign entities of concern. It amends the Federal Funding Accountability and Transparency Act of 2006 to require disclosure of subawards (grants, contracts, etc.) to entities in or from countries of concern as defined in the William M. (Mac) Thornberry National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2021. The bill calls for the Director to establish consistent reporting guidelines within 90 days of enactment.
